Package game

Class GameTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameTimer
  • public class GameTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    A GameTimer is an object that sends a GameTimerAction to a Game at regular intervals. It can be used, for example, in games where players have deadlines for performing certain actions (e.g., chess clock, 24-second clock in a basketball simultation).

    If a Game creates and starts a GameTimer, which is created as follows: 

       // create timer to go off every 100 milliseconds
   GameTimer t = new GameTimer(this, 100);
   // start the game timer
   t.start();
    then the Game will receive a GameTimerAction every 100 milliseconds, and can perform whatever time-related operations it wishes to perform.

      Constructor for objects of class GameTimer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getTicks()
      The number of GameTimerActions sent to the game since the timer was started, or since the last reset was performed on this GameTimer.
      void reset()
      Resets the timer's tick-counter to zero.
      void start()
      Starts the timer.
      void stop()
      Stops the timer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameTimer

        public GameTimer​(Game g,
                 int interval)
        Constructor for objects of class GameTimer
        Parameters:
        g - the game to which GameTimerActions should be sent
        interval - the number of milliseconds between successive GameTimerAction sends

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the timer. Has no effect if the timer is already running.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the timer.

      • getTicks

        public int getTicks()
        The number of GameTimerActions sent to the game since the timer was started, or since the last reset was performed on this GameTimer.
        Returns:
        if a reset had been performed, the number of ticks since the most recent reset; otherwise since the object was created.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the timer's tick-counter to zero.
